it.unipr.netsec.ipstack.tcp

Class ServerSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.netsec.ipstack.tcp.ServerSocketImpl
      • it.unipr.netsec.ipstack.tcp.ServerSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ServerSocket

    public class ServerSocket
extends ServerSocketImpl
    Server socket. It provides the same interface of ServerSocket. It extends ServerSocketImpl by adding the missing method accept().

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class it.unipr.netsec.ipstack.tcp.ServerSocketImpl

        DEBUG, local_inetaddr, local_port

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ServerSocket(TcpLayer tcp_layer)
      Creates an unbound server socket.
      ServerSocket(TcpLayer tcp_layer, int port)
      Creates a server socket, bound to the specified port.
      ServerSocket(TcpLayer tcp_layer, int port, int backlog)
      Creates a server socket and binds it to the specified local port number, with the specified backlog.
      ServerSocket(TcpLayer tcp_layer, int port, int backlog, java.net.InetAddress bindAddr)
      Create a server with the specified port, listen backlog, and local IP address to bind to.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Socket accept()
      Listens for a connection to be made to this socket and accepts it.

        public ServerSocket(TcpLayer tcp_layer)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates an unbound server socket.
        Parameters:
        tcp_layer - the TCP layer

        java.io.IOException

      • ServerSocket

        public ServerSocket(TcpLayer tcp_layer,
                    int port)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a server socket, bound to the specified port. A port number of 0 means that the port number is automatically allocated.
        Parameters:
        tcp_layer - the TCP layer
        port - the server port
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • ServerSocket

        public ServerSocket(TcpLayer tcp_layer,
                    int port,
                    int backlog)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a server socket and binds it to the specified local port number, with the specified backlog.
        Parameters:
        tcp_layer - the TCP layer
        port - the server port
        backlog - a given backlog
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • ServerSocket

        public ServerSocket(TcpLayer tcp_layer,
                    int port,
                    int backlog,
                    java.net.InetAddress bindAddr)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Create a server with the specified port, listen backlog, and local IP address to bind to.
        Parameters:
        tcp_layer - the TCP layer
        port - the server port
        backlog - a given backlog
        bindAddr - the IP address to be bound to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

              throws java.io.IOException
        Listens for a connection to be made to this socket and accepts it.

        the new socket
